Articles.Content:
What is the lowest periapsis for a orbit that dont make u come crashin down to the surface on Dres?

Edited April 22, 2014 by Billyk88
Just above surface height. Since Dres has no atmosphere as long as you are not going to crash into any mountains you should be fine. I generally orbit at about 10-20km.

Highest point on Dres is supposedly 5670 m so anything above that is safe. You may choose higher orbit to have favorable time warp ratios, though.

From the Oberth effect point of view, difference between 6 km orbit and 20 km orbit is (with its 138 km radius) very small.

Edited April 22, 2014 by Kasuha
Ok thank you all for the tips

Dres? Dres?!? Don't talk to me about that place. I don't like it.

My first (and most likely last) flyby probe.

Perhaps once I get to Duna I'll send another, but Duna comes first.
My "flyby" probe for Dres turned into a "slam into the surface of the plane" instead.
I've had the unintended impactor experience on Dres my own self. Moar delta-V helps, obviously.

Dres? Dres?!? Don't talk to me about that place. I don't like it.

No one likes Dres. I even recall a whole thread about Dres being creepy.

I like Dres; it's easy to land on if you're starting from Duna!

I'm currently doing a Jool to Dres transfer in my save, I wonder how it's going to go...
